blog.name: thedemonphanti
blog.title: thedemonphanti
blog.description: Treat People With Respect | Unpopular Opinions Welcome

summary: Then could we say the same things about memes ? And tiktok and everything that has a random person become a...
question: Then could we say the same things about memes ? And tiktok and everything that has a random person become a meme/ajoke/athingtolaughabout (in the case of fanfics and stuff having to be thought on how the person will react) because i cannot imagine how the people in some meme reaction pictures must feel when their face becomes a joke
answer: I don’t think there is a cut and dry answer to this, although I think it is a very interesting and relevant question at the moment, which is why I believe I said that people should consider how the subjects would feel and not just not to do it outright. I think one of the things that should be taken into consideration is what the subject themselves put into the public sphere though. If you put something on social media, it no longer belongs to you. That’s a harsh reality. On the other hand, I think when a person is are taking something, whether it be a image or information, and transforming it, they should also have a responsibility to act morally/ethically in how they are using it. I think in a lot of cases people don’t do that. In the phandom specifically, I think there are a lot of issues that arise because a lot of the “transformative work” is sexually explicit and inherently objectifies Dan and Phil and because it is posted on social media in places where they, as social media influencers, conduct their business, there is a lot of gray area with regards to sexual harassment. There are so many additional issues that arise from a lot of the fan fiction and fan art because it is pornographic in nature. For example, is it alright for adults to write porn about minors and/or for minors? Is it alright to graphically portray a real person being a victim of sexual violence (whether they see it or not)? The only thing I do know for sure is that anyone who tries to deny there are big moral/ethical questions raised by this type of activity in real person fandoms is irresponsible at best and probably shouldn’t be engaging in any of it.

For example, is it alright for adults to write porn about minors and/or for minors? Is it alright to graphically portray a real person being a victim of sexual violence (whether they see it or not)? The only thing I do know for sure is that anyone who tries to deny there are big moral/ethical questions raised by this type of activity in real person fandoms is irresponsible at best and probably shouldn’t be engaging in any of it.

also ⬆️ bonus panel because that story about phil undoing dan’s perfect string bow on his hoodie was too cute 💕

blog.name: dramaphan
blog.title: Yo I Comment On The Drama When Shit Hits The Fan
blog.description:
Phandom drama? It's more likely than you think.

.

My ask box is always open if you need a place to be dramatic, share theories, conspiracies, opinions, or general grievances. Fire away, my babies. Nothing is off limits. (Except for the things that are.)

.

Icon by phanniephobic, header by cinnamonnutlester

summary: While we are talking how bad it is to assume their sexuality (and I totally agree) and we're talking about their eventual secret...
question: While we are talking how bad it is to assume their sexuality (and I totally agree) and we're talking about their eventual secret double life it's always Phil with wife and kids and Dan is the one who spends every night with different girl. Why? I know it was used only as an example but it's always this way.
answer:
Honestly I think the Phil half of this question is just because we always go back to that one ridiculous rumour about Phil’s secret wife and child from a couple years back. As for the Dan half, I honestly can’t tell you. Maybe just because, like I said, we always go back to referencing that “Phil has a secret family” joke and the “Dan’s a hoe” thing is kind of in contrast to that. Like showing two extremes.

That’s my best guess, anyway.

summary: or maybe he's going through his second puberty and he's desperately trying to figure out how to stop the facial hair growth and...
question: or maybe he's going through his second puberty and he's desperately trying to figure out how to stop the facial hair growth and his god awful crackling voice not to mention he has gained another 7 cm in height and he's been re-configuring his entire filming setup to accommodate his giant genes to the point where he'll probably just sit on the floor in any future filming
answer: Oh god, forget Tan Dan. The real horror is Beard Dan! You’re right, nobody is emotionally prepared for that

summary: Thirsty AF  Person A is at a work event, when their friends suddenly sees Person C. Since they know how thirsty A gets, seeing...
body:
Thirsty AF

Person A is at a work event, when their friends suddenly sees Person C. Since they know how thirsty A gets, seeing their ex ©, and C is coming towards them, they need a distraction plan… FAST.

But A has already seen C and they don’t know what to do, so A turns to B begging them to pretend to be their new lover. C, knowing A very well, is immediately suspicious, considering A normally doesn’t move on this fast. Will A convince C ? Or will C convince A? And where does B fall into all of this?

Obviously you can decide wether A ends up with C or B

tags: also phil is me bc i always do this to my wife and her dimples
body:
dimples

a short drabble bc I saw this piece of art by @laurainlilac and now dan’s dimples are all I can think about

💕⭐️💜🥰


Dan hated his dimples, he always had. They made his cheeks too tight when he smiled, or made any sort of facial expression really.


That changed when he met Phil though. Phil had gushed about how cute they were, and how he desperately wanted to poke his fingers in them, which he did seconds after they had met. Neither had even said hello before Phil’s finger was pressing that spot on his cheek where it was deepest.


“It’s so cute!” he had squealed, frightening the people walking past.


He had never stopped being fascinated by them either. When Dan was having a bad day, and wanted affection, Phil would kiss the same spots on his cheeks, over and over, until Dan would acquiesce and smile, making Phil let out a delighted sound.


Every night before bed, Phil would poke and prod until Dan would grin and he would poke his finger in and giggle, like some sort of child.


“So cuteeee,” he would murmur sleepily and then kiss Dan before laying down, leaving Dan with pink cheeks and a dopey smile.

summary:
@magenta-au Instagram's story  

ART | COMMISSIONS | YOUTUBE | TWITTER | INSTAGRAM | REDBUBBLE

blog.name: imnotinclinedtomaturity
blog.title: just your average internet trash
blog.description: kat, 26, she/her, queer. i'm keeping my promise to write more. roughly 80% phan, 10% self deprecating shit about my life, and 10% gossip about mine and my followers love lives fics ~ love yourself ~ icon

summary: idk why 2019 has transported us into a famous-yt!phil + his nonfamous-shy!dan bf au, but i hate it and i’d like a refund.

blog.name: phanfictioncatalogue
blog.title: phanfiction catalogue
blog.description:
mobile users, click here!

please refer to our FAQ first.

Our goal is to create an alphabetized library of every phanfiction in the phandom. Besides that, we compile masterlists of different genres that are scheduled for posting every few days, and help find fics that have been mislocated.

title: Arranged Marriage (2) Masterlist
body:
part one

Actually.. He Is My Husband (ao3) - vanitasvanity

Summary: Dan, an airhead and famous 18 years old YouTuber. He is doing so well in his life, until one day.. his mom announced that Dan will need to marry Phil, a very quiet (not so quiet actually) but yet complicated 22 years old man. Not just complicated, he is Dan’s lecturer too!

An Arranged Marriage (ao3) - MarriedPhan1234

Summary: Dan and Phil are forced to marry each other, even though they’ve never met. Differing life experiences leave the boys unsure of how this could possibly work.

Arranged Marriage - pasteldanhowells

Summary: Dan and Phil’s marriage have been arranged by their parents, and neither of them are exactly thrilled about it. Dan’s younger than Phil and Phil had his whole life planned out but now things have changed. It’s December now, and Dan’s terrified he’ll have to spend Christmas alone. But he gets a surprise.

Arranged Marriage - helloanonymouswriter

Summary: Phil’s parents say that if Phil doesn’t have a wife by 25 then he’ll be set up in an arranged marriage. Luckily his best friend Dan is there to help.

Arrangements & Engagements (ao3) - iguessicantry

Summary: Alternate Universe in which all marriages are arranged. Parents wait until their children are teens, learn their sexuality and find a suitable match for them. Dan and Phil, both from affluent families, are engaged to be married. They aren’t happy about it.

Forgive Me (ao3) - FollowYourDreams

Summary: The year is 2224. Dan Howell is the prince of Pacis, living in the lavish Community, dreading his 21st birthday. Phil Lester is a servant at the Community, and has been for 6 years ever since he was taken from his home. On a fateful day, Dan and Phil lock eyes for the first time, and everything changes, but neither of them know if it’s for better or worse.

Free. (ao3) - alwayswriting

Summary: He knew he was engaged to the prince – Philip, his parents had told him. They had always told him he was part of some prophecy. But, while they seemed to think it would all be worth it in the end, Dan was beginning to have his doubts.

In a Strange Room With a New Last Name (ao3) - yellowlampshade

Summary: The first thing Dan did after accepting the proposal was write to Chris.

Just days after turning eighteen, Dan is forced by his parents to accept a marriage proposal from an Alpha he’s never met.

“Daniel? Daniel, wait, you don’t have to…” Philip was behind him, his hand on Dan’s to stop him from undressing, and he couldn’t be numb anymore. Every feeling hit him at once and suddenly he was crying and couldn’t stop. He brought his hands to his face to muffle his sobs, and this wasn’t how this was supposed to happen, it was so much better when he felt nothing because now everything hurt. He missed his room and his friends and his brother and Chris and he was so afraid of this.

In Manum (ao3) - nefertiti1052

Summary: Dan and Phil’s historically accurate wedding in ancient Rome.

New Life - pasteldanhowells

Summary: Omega!Phil is being forced to leave his family home to live with Alpha!Dan. He knows nothing about this man, and doesn’t speak to him for weeks, even after they’ve moved together. When Dan thinks all hope is lost, a miracle happens.

One Day - pasteldanhowells

Summary: pastel!dan is a kindergarten teacher and is married to punk!youtuber!phil, who he hates and doesn’t get along with at all. They’re parents forced them to marry each other. Dan is unhappy but things finally take a turn.

Shining Bright and Growing Strong - queenofallcorgis

Summary: Game of Thrones Crossover. Phil was not pleased that his father had basically bought him a husband in exchange for an army. He was equally displeased that his new husband was scared to death of him.

The King’s Court (ao3) - Unpluggedsocialfilter

Summary: Prince Daniel is born as the son of Mary, Queen of Scots, and a half cousin to Queen Elizabeth of England. His birth is celebrated far and wide, a baby to unite the rival Kingdoms of England and Scotland under a peaceful sceptre. But when his mother is charged with regicide and is forced to abdicate, panic and self-interest run rampant. Lords rush to Edinburgh to take charge in Dan’s infant name as James VI of Scotland, to change the course of nations, and to reign supreme.

Step into 1580s Europe with Dan when he begins his reign over this religiously terrorised land. Experience the true stories of scandals that plagued 16th century Scotland as the King struggles to manage the pressures of public life. Which alliances should keep him safe, what advice should he take? Perhaps the biggest question of all: who is the rightful ruler of these fair isles? The Catholic Mary Stuart, the Protestant Elizabeth Tudor, and the secretly gay King Dan are all possibilities in this historical drama. Religious intolerance, political power struggles, scandalous gay romances, et al.

The ball is, as they say, in the King’s Court. And it’s all too real.

The Path To Happiness - whiskersandquiff

Summary: Phil, Prince of Stratalary, has an arranged marriage with Daniel, Prince of Iridacia. He doesn’t think he’ll have any feelings for the prince, that is, until he meets him.

Together - oakleysfthoying

Summary: Dan is young when he’s arranged to be married to a man twice his age, and he’s not happy about it. At age 18, he’s a father to two twin boys. At this point, he’s practically a single father because his husband is never home. They don’t get along, and finally one day, Dan breaks down.

We Found Love Right Where We Are (ao3) - tiniestbauble

Summary: In a world where marriages are arranged by parents and sex is something sacred to be saved for after marriage, Dan and Phil take nervous steps towards each other after their marriage, learning more about each other and more about love.

White Lilies - yiffandquiff

Summary: Dan’s only knowledge about the number across his wrist was that he knew someone else in the world had the same number as himself. His number read 90029101 and he knew that the 900 at the beginning didn’t matter but the rest did.

Wires (ao3) - DumpsterDiving101

Summary: Arranged marriage au where you are paired with a partner based on a test, and commitment is more vital in the relationship than love is. The story of Dan’s arranged marriage to Phil Lester, a man seven years his superior who postponed taking the test to work in the military.

Ebony is 17 years old and terrified to take the test and be arranged with someone. So it’s her father Dan’s duty to tell her the story of his marriage, from the initial fear and hatred that came with his obedience, to the feelings that followed.

Step into 1580s Europe with Dan when he begins his reign over this religiously terrorised land. Experience the true stories of scandals that plagued 16th century Scotland as the King struggles to manage the pressures of public life. Which alliances should keep him safe, what advice should he take? Perhaps the biggest question of all: who is the rightful ruler of these fair isles? The Catholic Mary Stuart, the Protestant Elizabeth Tudor, and the secretly gay King Dan are all possibilities in this historical drama. Religious intolerance, political power struggles, scandalous gay romances, et al.

The ball is, as they say, in the King’s Court. And it’s all too real.

The Path To Happiness - whiskersandquiff

Summary: Phil, Prince of Stratalary, has an arranged marriage with Daniel, Prince of Iridacia. He doesn’t think he’ll have any feelings for the prince, that is, until he meets him.

Together - oakleysfthoying

Summary: Dan is young when he’s arranged to be married to a man twice his age, and he’s not happy about it. At age 18, he’s a father to two twin boys. At this point, he’s practically a single father because his husband is never home. They don’t get along, and finally one day, Dan breaks down.

We Found Love Right Where We Are (ao3) - tiniestbauble

Summary: In a world where marriages are arranged by parents and sex is something sacred to be saved for after marriage, Dan and Phil take nervous steps towards each other after their marriage, learning more about each other and more about love.

White Lilies - yiffandquiff

Summary: Dan’s only knowledge about the number across his wrist was that he knew someone else in the world had the same number as himself. His number read 90029101 and he knew that the 900 at the beginning didn’t matter but the rest did.

Wires (ao3) - DumpsterDiving101

Summary: Arranged marriage au where you are paired with a partner based on a test, and commitment is more vital in the relationship than love is. The story of Dan’s arranged marriage to Phil Lester, a man seven years his superior who postponed taking the test to work in the military.

Ebony is 17 years old and terrified to take the test and be arranged with someone. So it’s her father Dan’s duty to tell her the story of his marriage, from the initial fear and hatred that came with his obedience, to the feelings that followed.

blog.name: dramaphan
blog.title: Yo I Comment On The Drama When Shit Hits The Fan
blog.description:
Phandom drama? It's more likely than you think.

.

My ask box is always open if you need a place to be dramatic, share theories, conspiracies, opinions, or general grievances. Fire away, my babies. Nothing is off limits. (Except for the things that are.)

.

Icon by phanniephobic, header by cinnamonnutlester

summary: Just wanted to let you know I'm totally with you on the sexuality stuff. It's wrong to assume he's straight and it's equally as...
question: Just wanted to let you know I'm totally with you on the sexuality stuff. It's wrong to assume he's straight and it's equally as wrong to assume he's not straight. The only thing we can assume because he's already said it word by word is that he's not gay. And that's where we should leave it because we all know he doesn't even like labels to begin with.
answer:
Thank you, exactly.

A lot of people like to use the fact that Dan has said things about men being attractive or whatever but what so many people fail to realize, is that finding someone of any sex or gender visually appealing has absolutely nothing to do with your sexuality. If a straight guy says “dude Thor is kind of hot.” It’s probably not because he’s gay for Thor, but because he has functional eyes and he can identify when another man is visually attractive. The same exact way girls can tell each other they look pretty all day long and nobody bats an eyeball. You can be a girl, and think another girl is attractive, without being attracted to girls. So if Dan, or any man expresses that he thinks another man looks good and your first reaction is to assume he must be gay, congrats, your idea of masculinity is toxic and you aren’t sure how sexualities work.

The man doesn’t like labels. He’s said that. So instead of looking at his behaviour and he things he says and trying to stereotype him into whatever label you think fits him best, maybe let’s all just accept that we don’t know, and we don’t need to know.
